body:
Comment 8: 
i mean the policy for adding commits to the release branches. (e.g. critical bugfixes
with no workaround available; and for godoc, this condition is even less likely to be
true than the main tree)

even if we provide a tag for go.tools repository, it doesn't guarantee that you can
get identical build every time with "go get" (for example, go.tools depends on go.net,
but we don't even have release-branch.go1.2 branch for the go.net sub-repository)

If you really want to do identical build, i think the best bet will be to record the
exact revision for every dependencies, or distribute tarballs of required source code.
